snippet: The writings of the architecture critic Ada Louise Huxtable show that she cared about public standards, social equity and the whole city.
abstract: Michael Kimmelman looks back on life and work of architecture critic Ada Louise Huxtable, who has died at age 91; reflects that her writings show that she cared about public standards, social equity and New York City.
lead_paragraph: The writings of the architecture critic Ada Louise Huxtable show that she cared about public standards, social equity and the whole city.

headline.seo: Ada Louise Huxtable, Appraisal of an Architecture Critic
headline.main: A Critic of the Curb and Corner
headline.print_headline: A Critic Of the Curb And Corner
